result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Angelo Gill Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments  and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/2021.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two in 15CF222, count one and two  in 14CF4509. Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 233 days, 1/8/2015 to 8/28/2015.

superMiscConds.notes:
Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.
Seek/maintain fulltime employment.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affilate.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Complete parenting or fatherhood course.
Fine set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one in 15CF222, count one and two in 14CF4509. Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 233 days, 1/8/2015 to 8/28/2015.

Defendant's pro se request for ERP eligibility.
Original Transcript (38 pages) commencing SENTENCING 08/28/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Michael Angelo Gill in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Michael Angelo Gill in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, concurrent with count 2 in 15CF222, count 1 in 14CF4509 and count 2 in 14CF4509, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 233 days (01-08-2015 to 08-28-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- No driver license suspension imposed. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2021; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 in 15CF222, count 1 in 14CF4509 and count 2 in 14CF4509, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 233 days (01-08-2015 to 08-28-2015); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2021; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Angelo Gill in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Angelo Gill in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Doctor's report reviewed by parties.  There being no challenges to Dr. Luzi's report by the State, defense or defendant, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  The defendant is committed on 02-23-2015 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The defendant shall be given 46 days of credit for precommitment incarceration.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report authored by Dr. Luzi, received and filed.
Justice Point Discharge Summary dated February 5, 2015, received and filed.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return in Branch 17.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
